character.name: Malchus bar Eleazar
alternative_names: The one whose ear was healed
character.symbolic_representation: The Hidden Guardian; bridge between authority and faith
character.brief_description: A High Priest's servant whose healed ear marks him as a secret believer, quietly protecting resurrection witnesses while serving in the heart of opposition.
character.full_description: Malchus is the High Priest's personal servant, present during Christ's arrest when his ear was cut off and miraculously healed. This healing transforms him into a secret believer who must navigate the impossible tension between his duty to Caiaphas and his recognition of divine truth. He becomes a guardian of resurrection witnesses like Longinus, using his position within the Temple hierarchy to protect those marked by grace. His character embodies quiet courageâ€”facing impossible situations with steady composure while carrying dangerous secrets that would mean execution if discovered.
